subject: Languages
title: Celtic Languages Pushed to the Margins
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Celtic Languages Pushed to the Margins.

hook.text: Britain was Celtic-speaking for thousands of years. English nearly erased all of it.

buildup.text: Welsh, Cornish, and Scottish Gaelic were the original languages of the British Isles.

discovery.text: When the Anglo-Saxons arrived, they pushed Celtic speakers west and north.

twist.text: English borrowed almost nothing from Celtic â€” fewer than a dozen common words survived.

climax.text: Place names are the exception. London, Thames, and Dover all come from Celtic roots.

punchline.text: English conquered Britain but kept the old names on the map.

quiz.question: Which of these English words has Celtic origins?
